TopicTitle: objects clip through fairings from inside.

Articles.Content:
As the title says, if something is wobbly enough it clips through the fairing.

Is this 'as intented'. I thought they were solid parts.

They aren't as solid as you think no, not to parts attached to the same vessel anyway as physics between parts of the same craft was disabled back in 0.17 I think, there was a lot of trouble with aircraft bending and becoming unflyable due to clipped parts.

Other craft that impact the fairings will hit them and break them though, including your upper stage when detached, as it immediately becomes a separate vessel.

Wobble is making this a lot more obvious than it should be, struts only help a bit and I think the new fairing bases are a lot less rigid compared to other parts, it's like they are made of rubber.
